content.question: An antiderivative of <math alttext="the fraction with numerator e to the x power, and denominator e to the x power, minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="the natural log of, the absolute value of, e to the x power, minus 1, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements about the integral <math alttext="the integral from, negative 2 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator e to the x power, and denominator e to the x power, minus 1, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is true?

choices.label: The integral equals <math alttext="the fraction with numerator e squared, and denominator e squared, minus 1, end fraction, minus, the fraction with numerator e to the negative 2 power, and denominator e to the negative 2 power, minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The integral equals <math alttext="the natural log of, the absolute value of, e squared, minus 1, end absolute value, minus, the natural log of, the absolute value of, e to the negative 2 power, minus 1, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The integral diverges because <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 0 from the left, of, the fraction with numerator e to the x power, and denominator e to the x power, minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.

The integral diverges because <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 0 from the left, of, the natural log of, the absolute value of, e to the x power, minus 1, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>|</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.

content.answer: The integral diverges because <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 0 from the left, of, the natural log of, the absolute value of, e to the x power, minus 1, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>|</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
